conclusion: Apply Faraday's Law of Induction to find the EMF induced in the coil.
Magnetic flux through the coil is calculated using the formula Φ = B · A · cos(θ).
Since the plane of the coil is perpendicular to the magnetic field, cos(θ) = 1.
The area of the coil is A = a².
Magnetic flux through the coil when the magnetic field is B is Φ = B · (a²/2).
Change in magnetic flux is calculated as ΔΦ = Φf - Φi.
Rate of change of magnetic flux over time Δt is ΔΦ/Δt = B · (a²/2) / Δt.
Induced EMF is given by E = n · ΔΦ/Δt.
Substitute the rate of change of magnetic flux to get E = n · B · (a²/2) / Δt.
Final expression for EMF is E = n · B · a² / (2 · Δt).
